questions.question: What is artificial intelligence?

options.c: The simulation of human intelligence in machines

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of supervised learning?
What is a neural network?

options.a: A network of neurons in the brain
options.b: A computational model inspired by the way neural networks in the human brain process information

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of unsupervised learning?
What is overfitting in machine learning?

options.a: When a model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
options.b: When a model performs well on new data but poorly on training data
options.c: When a model is too simple to capture the underlying pattern of the data

questions.question: What does the term 'supervised learning' imply?

options.a: The learning algorithm is given labeled data
options.b: The learning algorithm is given unlabeled data
options.c: The learning algorithm is not given any data

questions.question: What is reinforcement learning?

options.a: A type of learning where the model is trained on labeled data
options.b: A type of learning where the model is trained on unlabeled data
options.c: A type of learning where the model learns by interacting with an environment

questions.question: Which of the following algorithms is used for classification?
What is the purpose of a validation set?
Which of the following is a common activation function in neural networks?
What is the purpose of cross-validation in machine learning?

options.a: To improve the model's performance on training data
options.b: To estimate the model's performance on unseen data
options.c: To reduce the size of the training dataset
options.d: To increase the size of the validation set

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an unsupervised learning algorithm?
What is the main goal of clustering in machine learning?

options.a: To classify data into predefined categories
options.b: To reduce the dimensionality of the data
options.c: To find groups of similar data points

questions.question: What is the main characteristic of supervised learning?

options.a: The algorithm learns from labeled data
options.b: The algorithm learns from unlabeled data
options.c: The algorithm learns from reinforcement signals

questions.question: Which of the following is a key application of reinforcement learning?
Which of the following is an example of a decision tree algorithm?
What is the primary purpose of using a test set in machine learning?

options.c: To evaluate the model's performance on unseen data

questions.question: What is the term used for reducing the number of input variables in a dataset?
Which of the following is an example of a loss function used in regression?
What is the main advantage of using deep learning models?

options.a: They require less data to train
options.b: They can automatically extract features from raw data
options.c: They are less complex than traditional models

questions.question: What is the purpose of a learning rate in gradient descent?

options.a: To determine the size of the steps taken towards the minimum of the loss function
options.b: To determine the number of features in the model
options.c: To determine the size of the training data
options.d: To determine the number of epochs

questions.question: Which of the following is a measure of a model's accuracy?
What is 'batch size' in the context of machine learning?

options.a: The number of training examples used in one iteration
options.b: The total number of training examples
options.c: The number of features in the dataset
options.d: The number of layers in a neural network

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a generative model?
What is the 'curse of dimensionality'?

options.a: The difficulty in managing large datasets
options.b: The increase in computational cost as the number of dimensions grows
options.c: The problem of overfitting in high-dimensional space

questions.question: Which of the following techniques can be used to prevent overfitting?
What is 'dropout' in the context of neural networks?

options.a: A technique for randomly ignoring some units during training

questions.question: Which of the following is an application of natural language processing?
What is 'AdaBoost'?
Which of the following is a common evaluation metric for regression models?
What is the purpose of feature scaling?

options.a: To standardize the range of independent variables
options.b: To reduce the number of features
options.c: To create new features from existing ones

questions.question: What does the 'R' in 'RNN' stand for?
What is the main advantage of using ensemble methods?

options.a: They increase the complexity of the model
options.b: They combine multiple models to improve performance
options.c: They reduce the amount of data needed
options.d: They simplify the interpretation of the model

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a hyperparameter?
What is the role of the softmax function in neural networks?

options.a: To activate neurons in the hidden layers

questions.question: What is a 'random forest'?
Which of the following is a common method for handling missing data?

options.c: Using algorithms that support missing values

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of data augmentation?

options.a: To create new data points from existing data
options.b: To reduce the dimensionality of the data
options.c: To select the most important features

questions.question: What does 'GAN' stand for?
Which of the following is a technique for reducing overfitting in neural networks?
What is the purpose of a confusion matrix?

options.a: To evaluate the performance of a classification model
options.b: To evaluate the performance of a regression model
options.c: To reduce the dimensionality of the data

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a learning rate in training neural networks?

options.a: To determine the number of layers
options.b: To control the step size during gradient descent
options.c: To decide the number of neurons

questions.question: What is 'bias' in the context of neural networks?

options.a: A weight associated with each neuron
options.b: A term that allows the activation function to shift

questions.question: Which of the following is an optimization algorithm used for training neural networks?
What does 'CNN' stand for in machine learning?
What is the purpose of the activation function in a neural network?

options.a: To introduce non-linearity into the network
options.c: To reduce the number of parameters

questions.question: What is a common use of the sigmoid activation function?

options.a: In hidden layers of neural networks
options.b: In the output layer for binary classification

questions.question: What is the purpose of the ReLU activation function?

options.a: To squash input values to the range [0, 1]
options.b: To allow only positive input values to pass through

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using dropout in neural networks?

options.c: It reduces the need for large datasets
